physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a road stretching from the left to the front-right of the photograph. Along the road
 there are several cars parked. Several tentages are set up. There is a crowd of people seen under the tentages
 amongst the vehicles. There is a section of a banner seen on the left of the photograph. There is a motorcyclist driving down the road in the center. There is a slight fold mark along the vertical centre of the photograph.
subject_terms_1:races (events) automobile racing spectators (event observers) snapshots
subject_terms_2:Photographs Racetracks (Automobile racing) Spectators
subject_terms_3:Photography Auto racing events
subject_terms_4:
sgcool_label_text:This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life
 including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a road stretching from the left to the front-right of the photograph. Along the road, there are several cars parked. Several tentages are set up. There is a crowd of people seen under the tentages, amongst the vehicles. There is a section of a banner seen on the left of the photograph. There is a motorcyclist driving down the road in the center. There is a slight fold mark along the vertical centre of the photograph.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
